reactor.rx.broadcast

Class Broadcaster<O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.rx.Stream<O>
      • reactor.rx.action.Action<O,O>
        • reactor.rx.broadcast.Broadcaster<O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.reactivestreams.Processor<O,O>, org.reactivestreams.Publisher<O>, org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<O>, NonBlocking, Recyclable, Consumer<O>, Control
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BehaviorBroadcaster, SerializedBroadcaster

    public class Broadcaster<O>
extends Action<O,O>
    A Broadcaster is a subclass of Stream which exposes methods for publishing values into the pipeline. It is possible to publish discreet values typed to the generic type of the Stream as well as error conditions and the Reactive Streams "complete" signal via the onComplete() method.
    Author:
    Stephane Maldini

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <T> Broadcaster<T> create()
        Build a Broadcaster, ready to broadcast values with .Broadcaster#onNext(Object), onError(Throwable), onComplete(). Values broadcasted are directly consumable by subscribing to the returned instance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values passing through the Broadcaster
        Returns:
        a new Broadcaster

      • create

        public static <T> Broadcaster<T> create(Environment env)
        Build a Broadcaster, ready to broadcast values with onNext(Object), onError(Throwable), onComplete(). Values broadcasted are directly consumable by subscribing to the returned instance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values passing through the Broadcaster
        Parameters:
        env - the Reactor Environment to use
        Returns:
        a new Broadcaster

      • subscribeWithSubscription

        protected void subscribeWithSubscription(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<? super O> subscriber,
                                         PushSubscription<O> subscription)
        Description copied from class: Action
        Subscribe a given subscriber and pairs it with a given subscription instead of letting the Stream pick it automatically.

        This is mainly useful for libraries implementors, usually this#lift(reactor.fn.Supplier) and this#subscribe(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber) are just fine.

        Overrides:
        subscribeWithSubscription in class Action<O,O>

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Description copied from interface: Control
        Stop consuming signals from upstream. Cancel should not be considered blocking, but usually it happens to be rather immediate as it will be updating PushSubscription.terminated flag.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Control
        Overrides:
        cancel in class Action<O,O>
